result.execSummary:
The defendant Dvontay James Goodwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: With 29 days credit CONSECUTIVE to Count 2 and CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
Cash bail on deposit to be applied.  Any remaining cash bail to be returned to the person who posted.
Obtain a GED/HSED. Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with victims or co-actors.
No use of alcohol or drugs.  No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Cooperate with the Probation Department.
Letter of apology to the victims.
Provide a DNA sample.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dvontay James Goodwin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Check Packet

As to both Counts:  Defendant pleads GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
As to Count 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 29 days credit CONSECUTIVE to Count 2 and CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
As to Count 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections.
Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on 18 MONTHS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- No possession of weapons
- Letter of apology to the victims
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No use of alcohol or drugs.  No possession of drug paraphenalia.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain a GED/HSED
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education.
- No contact with:  victims or co-actors
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Cash bail on deposit to be applied.  Any remaining cash bail to be returned to the person who posted.

Filed:   
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Dvontay James Goodwin in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Dvontay James Goodwin in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading.  
Court ordered charge amended to two counts of Theft, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 943.20(1)(a) 939.05 , a Class A misdemeanor.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
